Notes.Text:
Ghostscript was updated to fix one security issue.

The following vulnerability was fixed:

* CVE-2015-3228: Specially crafted files could have caused an interger overflow, resulting in a crash of the application or unspecified other impact (bsc#939342)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: Integer overflow in the gs_heap_alloc_bytes function in base/gsmalloc.c in Ghostscript 9.15 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted Postscript (ps) file, as demonstrated by using the ps2pdf command, which triggers an out-of-bounds read or write.
